alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 10 at 4:21AM PST until March 11 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches in the valleys. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches for the mountains above 3000 feet. * WHERE...Metaline Falls, Springdale-Hunters Road, Flowery Trail Road, Metaline, Priest River, Bonners Ferry, Northport, Deer Park, Eastport, Sandpoint, Athol, Orin-Rice Road, Tiger, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Ione, Fruitland, Chewelah, Newport, Colville, Kettle Falls, and Clark Fork. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Motorists should prepare for winter driving conditions for the morning commute. The heaviest snow with this event is expected to fall in the 6 AM to 10 AM time frame. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel conditions will improve late in the morning and early in the afternoon as temperatures climb into the mid and upper 30s. However, snow showers late in the day into the evening may produce additional localized accumulations late in the day and into the evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
